page.title: 20CUSTOMS IN GARTMORE
page.content: The{Fairy Steps}are on a roadside verge. If you stand on them and make a wish it is supposed to come true and the dust which is on them brings luck. At{Halloween}we go guising (in disguise). We go to peoples houses and say or sing poems and they give us sweets and fruit. Not long ago the children had a week off for{Tattie Howkin'}(lifting potatoes). Now it is mostly done by machinery. Mr Cairney the{village composer}has written about 15 songs about the Gartmore area to keep alive memories of the past or a special event. "The Grand Bonspiel" was about a curling championship when the Lake of Menteith froze in 1982. "Baron of Buchlyvie" is about a famous local stallion and "The Silver Broom" is about a curling championship held in 1985 in Glasgow.
